result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:01 PM; Case called for Hearing. Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Cody J Robbins.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Klein provides an update; she is requesting the matter be set for plea and sentencing in 45-60 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:00 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cody J Robbins in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Cody J Robbins. Atty. Klein provides an update; she is still waiting on discovery and an offer.  Atty. Klein requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  State notes there is an offer in the file which it will forward to Atty. Klein; State will also route the file to make sure discovery is forwarded to Atty. Klein as well.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Appointing Attorney Jessica Klein
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

NEW CONDITIONS ORDERED ON 08/29/2022: Defendant to have no contact with any individuals, to include their residence, listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. 

PREVIOUSLY ISSUED CONDITIONS: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

9:44 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Cody J Robbins in court. Court notes there is Victim's request to be heard and inquires how the matter is proceeding.  State advises the victim is asking that there be a no contact order in this matter, as there is already a no contact order in 22CM1526.  Defendant advises he has no objection to the request.  Court will order the bail conditions be modified to be No contact with any individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint, to include their residence; all other conditions to remain as previously set.  Court inquires as to whether the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant would like to look into having a Public Defender represent him.  Court advises the defendant he should report to the Public Defender's office after court today to be evaluated.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:59 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Christian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody J Robbins not in court.  Atty. Farina notes the matter was set for hearing on the Victim's request to be heard.  Atty. Farina advises he has been attempting to contact the victim and notes this hearing was set at a short notice which may be why the defendant has not appeared today as well as the victim.  Atty. Farina is not asking the court to take any action with respect to this case today and it leave the previously scheduled status at the end of the month on the calendar.  Court will take no action and will maintain the previously scheduled hearing on 08/29/2022 at 9:30 AM.
Hearing on August 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:58 PM Defendant Cody J Robbins in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
